title.narrative: RESTORATIVE PRACTICES

description.narrative: Restorative justice and violence prevention approaches are enhanced and integrated into the work of social and justice institutions, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Technical Assistance - operating costs -- Staff Costs

REPUBLICAN CLINICAL CENTER OF PALLIATIVE MEDICAL CARE TO CHILDREN
REPUBLICAN SCIENTIFIC PRACTICAL CEN OF MEDICAL EXPERTISE AND REHABILITA STATE INSTITUTION

mailing-address.narrative: 22A Krasnoarmejskaya Street 220030 Minsk Republic of Belarus

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly and gender-responsive justice processes and procedures
Ending violence against women and girls
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building
Justice, law and order policy, planning and administration
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Response and support services for girls, boys, and women experiencing violence, exploitaiton, abuse and neglect

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Restorative justice and violence prevention approaches are enhanced and integrated into the work of social and justiceinstitutions

description.narrative: In 2021, the CO focused on strengthening referral pathways for children in conflict and contact with the law.; With adolescents’ critical need for legal aid and referrals, the CO supported development of nation-wide resources providing legal and psychological assistance, resulting in development of a new mobile legal aid application, Advokot, and expanding online counselling for child victims of cyber violence via kids.pomogut.by. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms (23-03-L3-03), Text

baseline.value: Restorative services for children in contact with the law exist partially in 4 communities based on the social pedagogical centers (2020)

target.value: 2025:Restorative services for children in contact with the law are integrated into a work of all social pedagogical centers in Belarus

actual.value: 2021:Development of in-service programme in progress to be finished in 2022
